sentences.english: He cites the pork industry, which used to be blighted with hog cholera.
sentences.chinese: 他列举了曾因猪霍乱而萎靡不振的养猪业。

sentences.english: Into early autumn, the mortgage market continued to slump.
sentences.chinese: 秋初，抵押贷款市场依然萎靡。

sentences.english: A life unlived is no different than death.
sentences.chinese: 萎靡的生命如同死亡本身。

sentences.english: Discovers his energetic dispirited until doctor, as soon as asked that only then knows the truth.
sentences.chinese: 直到医生发现他精神萎靡，一问才知真相。

sentences.english: Day by day, their spirits atrophy.
sentences.chinese: 日复一日，她们精神萎靡。

sentences.english: Plummeting stock, property and commodity markets have cleaned out many wealthy people.
sentences.chinese: 萎靡的股市，楼市和商品市场使大量的富人脱富返贫。

sentences.english: We were wilting under the burning sun.
sentences.chinese: 我们在烈日下变得萎靡不振。

sentences.english: So, Cicero first warned us against the danger of being lackadaisical .
sentences.chinese: 西塞罗首先警告我们要注意萎靡不振的危险。

sentences.english: Monica is dysfunctional because of her breakup with Richard.
sentences.chinese: 莫妮卡因为和里查德分手而萎靡不振。

sentences.english: He was too lazy to exert himself and rusted out long before his time.
sentences.chinese: 他懒得萎靡不振，因此早就未老先衰了。

sentences.english: She was enervated by the luxury of palace life.
sentences.chinese: 宫廷的奢华生活使她变得萎靡不振。

sentences.english: Now the market malaise appears to be spreading northward.
sentences.chinese: 现在市场萎靡正在向北方扩展。

sentences.english: The Chinese new year occurred in February last year and depressed exports that month.
sentences.chinese: 中国春节去年在2月份，同月出口萎靡。
长期借款依然萎靡不振。

definition: to wither/to dry up (of a plant)/to atrophy (of muscle, social custom etc)
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
